questions.question: Which of the following is a weak password?
What is a common method to improve the security of online accounts?
choices: A) Keeping passwords written down on sticky notes
C) Sharing passwords with friends and family
D)  Using the same password for multiple accounts

questions.question: Which one of the following is a type of antivirus program?
Which of the following describes the process for verifying the integrity of a message?
To protect the computer system against hackers and viruses, what is an essential tool to always keep on in the computer system?
What is the purpose of a VPN?
choices: A) Blocks access to certain websites
C) Encrypts internet traffic to protect data and privacy
questions.answer: C)  Encrypts internet traffic to protect data and privacy

questions.question: What is the initial step to take when responding to a cybersecurity incident?
choices: B)  Immediately paying any demanded ransom
C) Ignoring the incident and hoping it goes away
D) Reporting the incident to the proper authorities
questions.answer: D) Reporting the incident to the proper authorities

questions.question: Which of the following can be considered as the elements of cyber security?
Why do hackers usually use computer viruses?
choices: A) To log, monitor each and every user's stroke
B) To gain access the sensitive information like user's Id and Passwords
C) To log, monitor each and every user's stroke

questions.question: In cybersecurity, what is encryption?
choices: A) The process of monitoring and analyzing network traffic for potential security threats
B) The process of physically securing a computer system to prevent tampering
C) The process of encoding information in such a way that only authorized parties can access it
D) The process of updating software to fix security vulnerabilities
questions.answer: C) The process of encoding information in such a way that only authorized parties can access it

questions.question: Cyber Security provide security against what?
choices: B) Defends a device from threat.

questions.question: Which of the below is a kind of cyber security?
Which of the below does not constitute a cybercrime?
choices: D) AES which stands for Advanced Encryption Standard (safeguards data by encoding it)
questions.answer: D) AES which stands for Advanced Encryption Standard (safeguards data by encoding it)

questions.question: Which of the below benefits of cyber security is not true?
choices: B) Safeguards a device against threats

questions.question: Which of the below is a popular victim of cyber attackers looking to gain the IP address of a target or victim user?
You accidentally download a file from a suspicious website and notice your computer behaving strangely. What should you do?
choices: A) Continue using the computer as norma
C) Run a virus scan and remove any malware detected
D) Revisit the website to get in touch.
questions.answer: C) Run a virus scan and remove any malware detected.

questions.question: You receive an email from an unknown sender that contains a link to click on. What should you do?
choices: A) Click on the link to see what it is
B) Delete the email without clicking on the link
C) Forward the email to your IT department for advice
D) Reply to the email and ask the sender for more information
questions.answer: B) Delete the email without clicking on the link

questions.question: You notice that your computer is running slowly and some of your files are missing. What should you do?
choices: A)  Ignore the issue and continue using your computer
B)  Reset your computer to factory settings
C) Run a virus scan on your computer
D) Call a computer repair technician for help
questions.answer: C) Run a virus scan on your computer

questions.question: Which of the below is an internet fraud in which a consumer is digitally persuaded to reveal personal data by cybercriminals?
Which of the following options means the security of data from tampering by unidentified users?
Which of the below implemented is not a good means of safeguarding privacy?
The authenticity and security of data travelling over a network are ensured by?
What is a single entrance for multiple connectivities called?
Which of the below can be classified as a type of computer threat?
In system hacking, which of the below is the most crucial activity?
Which of the below malware types permits the hackers to access administrative controls and do nearly everything he wants with the infected systems?
When any IT device, service, or system requires security checks, the term “security testing” is employed.?
Which of the below is a method of gaining access to a computer program or an entire computer system while circumventing all security measures?
Which of the following are programmes or procedures that enable hackers to maintain control of a computer system?
To ensure data/information security, what steps can be taken to preserve its confidentiality?
Why are the factors like Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability, and Authenticity considered as the fundamentals?
choices: A) They help in understanding the hacking process
B) These are the main elements for any security breach
C) They help to understand the security and its components in a better manner
questions.answer: C) They help to understand the security and its components in a better manner

questions.question: Which of the following is a type of independent malicious program that never required any host program?
Which of the following statements is true about the Trojans?
choices: A) Trojans perform tasks for which they are designed or programmed
B) Trojans replicates them self's or clone them self's through an infections
C) Trojans do nothing harmful to the user's computer systems
questions.answer: A) Trojans perform tasks for which they are designed or programmed

questions.question: Which type of the following malware does not replicate or clone them self's through infection?
Which one of the following statements is correct about Email security in the network security methods?
choices: A) One has to deploy hardware, software, and security procedures to lock those apps down.
B) One should know about what the normal behavior of a network look likes so that he/she can spot any changes, breaches in the behavior of the network.
C) Phishing is one of the most commonly used methods that are used by hackers to gain access to the network
questions.answer: C) Phishing is one of the most commonly used methods that are used by hackers to gain access to the network

questions.question: Which of the following principle of cyber security restricts how privileges are initiated whenever any object or subject is created?
Which one of the following principles of cyber security refers that the security mechanism must be as small and simple as possible?
When was the first computer virus created?
Which of the following statements is correct about the firewall?
choices: A) It is a device installed at the boundary of a company to prevent unauthorized physical access.
B) It is a device installed at the boundary of an incorporate to protect it against the unauthorized access.
C) It is a kind of wall built to prevent files form damaging the corporate.
questions.answer: B) It is a device installed at the boundary of an incorporate to protect it against the unauthorized access.

questions.question: In computer networks, encryption techniques are primarily used to improve which of the following?

questions_level_Basic.question: What is Cyber Security?
choices: A) Cyber Security provides security against malware
B) Cyber Security provides security against cyber-terrorists
C) Cyber Security protects a system from cyber attacks

questions_level_Basic.question: What does cyber security protect?
choices: B) Cyber security protects internet-connected systems
questions_level_Basic.answer: B) Cyber security protects internet-connected systems

questions_level_Basic.question: Which of the following is defined as an attempt to steal, spy, damage or destroy computer systems, networks, or their associated information?
Which of the following is a type of cyber security?
Which of the following is an objective of network security?
Which of the following is not a cybercrime?
Which of the following is a component of cyber security?
Which of the following is a type of cyber attack?
Which of the following is not an advantage of cyber security?
choices: A) Minimizes computer freezing and crashes

questions_level_Basic.question: In which year has hacking become a practical crime and a matter of concern in the field of cyber technology?
Which of the following act violates cyber security?
Which of the following actions compromise cyber security?
Which of the following is the hacking approach where cyber-criminals design fake websites or pages for tricking or gaining additional traffic?
Which of the following is not a type of peer-to-peer cyber-crime?
choices: B) Injecting Trojans to a target victim
C) Credit card details leak in the deep web
questions_level_Basic.answer: C) Credit card details leak in the deep web

questions_level_Basic.question: Which of the following do Cyber attackers commonly target for fetching IP address of a target or victim user?
Which of the following is defined as an attempt to harm, damage or cause threat to a system or network?
Organised criminals prefer cyber crime over traditional forms of crime as:
choices: A) It requires a higher level of skill.
B) It is high payoff with a relatively low risk
C) It is harder to detect.
questions_level_Basic.answer: B) It is high payoff with a relatively low risk

questions_level_Basic.question: For charities and other types of organisations, the reputational damage from a data breach can cause as much harm as the breach itself.
choices: C) Both options above are correct.

questions_level_Basic.question: Cyber crime is comprised entirely of online scams
choices: C) Both options above are correct

questions_level_Basic.question: Even when using the Cloud exclusively to store data, valuable information can be retrieved from stolen laptops.
choices: C) Both options above are correct

questions_level_Basic.question: You can always trust the contents of an email if it comes from a legitimate address at a trusted organisation.
choices: C) Both options above are correct

questions_level_Basic.question: Cyber crime is comprised entirely of online scams
choices: A) When your files are locked on your device and cannot be accessed without paying a ransom.
B) When your computer is locked and cannot be accessed without paying a ransom
C) When you are threatened with the release of stolen files unless you pay a ransom.

questions_level_Basic.question: A highly tailored email scam is known as:
If you find a suspicious device connected to your computer, you should:
choices: D) Do all of the above

questions_level_Basic.question: How many accounts should you use the same password for?
Is it okay to give your password to?
choices: A) An ‘IT Person’ who asks for it over the phone

questions_level_Basic.question: Passwords should be?
When should you use similar passwords?
choices: A) When the accounts are for similar things (eg Social Media Accounts)
D) On a few of your accounts

questions_level_Basic.question: What is the existence of weakness in a system or network is known as?
Which of the following is an internet scam done by cyber-criminals where the user is convinced digitally to provide confidential information.
Should you use personal information in your passwords?
choices: A) Yes, it makes them easier to remember
B) Yes, it helps to make them more personal
C) No, personal information could be found online and used by someone attempting to get access to your accounts
D) Yes, friends and family will remember them also
questions_level_Basic.answer: C) No, personal information could be found online and used by someone attempting to get access to your accounts

questions_level_Basic.question: A company's network is running slowly and employees suspect a cyberattack. What steps can they take to address the issue?
choices: B) Continue working and ignore the slow network
C) Contact IT and report the issue
D) Disconnect all devices from the network
questions_level_Basic.answer: C) Contact IT and report the issue

questions_level_Basic.question: If an employee downloads a malicious attachment in an email by mistake, what should they do?
choices: A) Report the incident to IT
B) Open the attachment to see what it contains
C) Delete the email and continue working
D) Take each of these actions.
questions_level_Basic.answer: A) Report the incident to IT

questions_level_Basic.question: What should a company do if its website is suddenly displaying inappropriate content?
choices: B) Contact their web hosting provider for assistance
C) Shut down the website permanently
D) a) Ignore the issue and hope it resolves on its own
questions_level_Basic.answer: B) Contact their web hosting provider for assistance

questions_level_Basic.question: When should you change your passwords?
choices: D) Every 6 Months or if the account has been breached
questions_level_Basic.answer: D) Every 6 Months or if the account has been breached

questions_level_Basic.question: Which of the below malware types permits the hackers to access administrative controls and do nearly everything he wants with the infected systems?
Which of the following attacks requires a carrier file to self-replicate?
What is Two Factor Authentication?
choices: A) A combination of more than two-character types in a password (eg Letters & Numbers)
B) A system confirming a single user with a combination of different factors before allowing access
C) Using the same password twice
D) Using two random words for your password
questions_level_Basic.answer: B) A system confirming a single user with a combination of different factors before allowing access

questions_level_Basic.question: What is the term used for cybercriminals repeatedly entering password combinations to break into an account or website?
If you receive an email from a well-known company, but its name is misspelt in the sender’s address, you should:
choices: A) click on the link in the email to check if it’s genuine
B) report it as a possible phishing scam
C) reply, pointing out the error
D) forward the email to a friend to check
questions_level_Basic.answer: B) report it as a possible phishing scam

questions_level_2.question: Exploits are programmes or procedures that enable hackers to maintain control of a computer system.?
choices: C) Antivirus is the correct answer.
D) Firewall by-passers is the correct answer

questions_level_2.question: Which of the following can diminish the chance of data leakage?
Which of the following is a Stuxnet?
Which of the following DDoS in mobile systems wait for the owner to trigger the cyber attack?
What type of characters should you include in a password?
Which one of the following is a strong password?
Who is it safe to tell your password to?
choices: A) A colleague who needs to send an urgent e-mail
B) Ebay, if they send you an e-mail first
C) Your best friend, just in case you forget it
D) You should never disclose your password to anyone
questions_level_2.answer: D) You should never disclose your password to anyone

questions_level_2.question: Which one of the following is NOT a weak password?
choices: A) An anagram of your favourite film
questions_level_2.answer: A) An anagram of your favourite film

questions_level_2.question: Which one of the following can be considered to be a hardware firewall?
Which one of the following is a key function of a firewall?
Which of the following is not an email-related hacking tool?
29. Which of the following term refers to a group of hackers who are both white and black hat?
Which of the following is not a step followed by cyber-criminals in data breaching?
Which of the following malicious programs, appearing to be legitimate, is commonly used to target banking and payment systems to access confidential information?
Choose the correct malware term that describes a controversial program designed to propagate across networks for the purpose of distributing security patches for known vulnerabilities.
Which of the following describes a self-replicating malware that spreads by duplicating itself in order to infect other devices without user interaction?
Once installed, which collection of software tools is used to gain remote access to and control over a computer or system?
A hybrid virus infects both files and system sectors and may incorporate which of the following?
choices: C) Any combination of the above
questions_level_2.answer: C) Any combination of the above

questions_level_2.question: Fill in the blanks: ______ is used legitimately in free versions of applications to display advertisements while a program is running but can be classified as ______ if the code records users' information or browsing habits without their consent and authorization.
Which of the following is not true of a keylogger?
choices: A) Task managers are enough to detect it.
B) It can require physical access to the target's device for installation.
C) It monitors and records keystrokes typed on a keyboard.
D) This surveillance technology is sometimes hardware-based.
questions_level_2.answer: A) Task managers are enough to detect it.

questions_level_2.question: Fill in the blank: Phishing, spear phishing, vishing, scareware and watering hole attacks are all types of ______.
Which of the following is not an indicator of a DoS attack?
choices: C) Lower than usual volume of spam email
D) Inability to access any website
questions_level_2.answer: C) Lower than usual volume of spam email

questions_level_2.question: Choose the term that describes the dangerous malware that takes over a victim's machine and abuses compute resources to mine digital currency and transfer it to the criminal's digital wallet.
Which of the following attacks uses a botnet to overwhelm a server or other network resource with fraudulent traffic, thus triggering the system to deny access to legitimate users?
